stress_test Package¶

common Module¶

Reusable functions for stress tests

stress_test.common.check_ds_hosts(controller_ip, controller_restconf_port, auth_token)[source]¶

Query number of hosts registered in ODL operational DS

Parameters:
  • controller_ip – controller IP address
  • controller_restconf_port – controller restconf port
  • auth_token – tuple with controller restconf user and password (controller_restconf_user, controller_restconf_password)
Returns:

number of hosts found, 0 if none exists and -1 in case of

error. :rtype: int :type controller_ip: str :type controller_restconf_port: int :type auth_token: tuple<str>

stress_test.common.check_ds_links(controller_ip, controller_restconf_port, auth_token)[source]¶

Query number of links registered in ODL operational DS

Parameters:
  • controller_ip – controller IP address
  • controller_restconf_port – controller restconf port
  • auth_token – tuple with controller restconf user and password (controller_restconf_user, controller_restconf_password)
Returns:

number of links found, 0 if none exists and -1 in case of

error. :rtype: int :type controller_ip: str :type controller_restconf_port: int :type auth_token: tuple<str>

stress_test.common.check_ds_switches(controller_ip, controller_restconf_port, auth_token)[source]¶

Query number of switches registered in ODL operational DS

Parameters:
  • controller_ip – controller IP address
  • controller_restconf_port – controller restconf port
  • auth_token – tuple with controller restconf user and password (controller_restconf_user, controller_restconf_password)
Returns:

number of switches found, 0 if none exists and -1 in case of

error. :rtype: int :type controller_ip: str :type controller_restconf_port: int :type auth_token: tuple<str>

stress_test.common.create_cpu_shares(controller_cpu_shares, generator_cpu_shares)[source]¶

Returns a tuple of 2 strings, in which we have the controller and generator CPU shares as a comma separated values.

Parameters:
  • controller_cpu_shares (int) – Percentage of CPU resources to be used by controller.
  • generator_cpu_shares (int) – Percentage of CPU resources to be used by generator.
stress_test.common.poll_ds_thread(controller_ip, controller_restconf_port, controller_restconf_auth_token, boot_start_time, expected_switches, discovery_deadline_ms, queuecomm)[source]¶

Poll operational DS to discover installed switches

Parameters:
  • controller_ip (str) – controller IP address
  • controller_restconf_port (int) – controller restconf port
  • auth_token – tuple with controller restconf user and controller restconf password (controller_restconf_user, controller_restconf_password)
  • boot_start_time (int) – The time we begin starting topology switches
  • expected_switches (int) – switches expected to find in the DS
  • discovery_deadline_ms (float) – deadline (in ms) at which the thread should discover switches (in milliseconds)
  • queuecomm (multiprocessing.Queue) – queue for communicating with the main context
stress_test.common.sample_stats(cpid)[source]¶

Take runtime statistics

Parameters:cpid (int) – controller PID
Returns:the statistics in a dictionary
Return type:dict

controller_utils Module¶

Reusable functions for processes that are controller related

stress_test.controller_utils.check_controller_status(controller_status_handler)[source]¶

Wrapper to the controller status handler

Parameters:controller_status_handler (str) – filepath to the controller status handler
Returns:‘1’ if controller is active, ‘0’ otherwise
Return type:str
stress_test.controller_utils.check_for_active_controller(controller_port)[source]¶

Checks for processes listening on the specified port

Parameters:controller_port (int) – controller port to check
Raises Exception:
 When another process Listens on controller’s port.

stress_test.controller_utils.restart_controller(controller_stop_handler, controller_start_handler, controller_status_handler, controller_port, old_cpid, controller_cpus_str)[source]¶

Restarts the controller

Parameters:
  • controller_start (str) – filepath to the controller start handler
  • controller_status (str) – filepath to the controller status handler
  • controller_stop (str) – filepath to the controller stop handler
  • controller_port (int) – controller port number to listen for SB connections
  • old_cpid (int) – PID of already running controller process
  • controller_cpus_str (str) – controller CPU share as a strin containing the values of shares, separated with comma
Returns:

controller process ID
Return type:

int

  • controller_status_handler (str) – filepath to the controller status handler
  • controller_port (int) – controller port number to listen for SB connections
  • controller_cpus_str (str) – controller CPU share as a strin containing the values of shares, separated with coma
Returns:

controller’s process ID
Raises Exception:
 

When controller fails to start.

  • controller_status_handler (str) – filepath to the controller status handler
  • cpid (int) – controller process ID
stress_test.controller_utils.wait_until_controller_listens(interval_ms, port)[source]¶

Waits for the controller to start listening on specified port.

Parameters:
  • interval_ms – milliseconds to wait (in milliseconds).
  • port – controller port.
Raises Exception:
 

If controller fails to start or if another process

listens on controllers port. :returns: on success, returns the controller pid. :rtype int :type interval_ms: int :type port: int

stress_test.controller_utils.wait_until_controller_up_and_running(interval_ms, controller_status_handler)[source]¶

Waits for the controller status to become 1 (Started).

Parameters:
  • interval_ms – milliseconds to wait (in milliseconds).
  • controller_status_handler – filepath to the controller status handler
Raises Exception:
 

If controller fails to start or if another process

listens on controllers port. :type interval_ms: int :type controller_status_handler: str

Bases: object

Object used to explore controller inventory flows, using the NB REST interface.

get_inventory_flows_stats()[source]¶

Collects and prints statistics information about all installed flows for all the nodes of the topology

class stress_test.flow_utils.FlowProcessor(flow_template, url_template, auth_token)[source]¶

Bases: object

Helper object used to add and remove flows based on predefined templates.

add_flow(flow_id, node_id, ip_dest)[source]¶

Adds a flow to the specified node

Parameters:
  • flow_id (int) – ID of the flow to add
  • node_id (int) – ID of the node to which we will add the flow
  • ip_dest (str) – IP address to populate the destination IP field of the flow template
Returns:

status code for the http call issued
Return type:

int
remove_flow(flow_id, node_id)[source]¶

Removes a flow from the specified node

Parameters:
  • flow_id (int) – ID of the flow to remove
  • node_id (int) – ID of the node from which the flow will be removed

generator_utils Module¶

Reusable functions for processes that are generator related

stress_test.generator_utils.cleanup_generator(generator_clean_handler)[source]¶

Shuts down the Generator.

Parameters:generator_clean_handler – Filepath to the handler that cleanup the

generator. :type generator_clean_handler: str

stress_test.generator_utils.generator_thread(generator_run_handler, generator_cpus, controller_ip, controller_port, threads, sw_per_thread, switches, thr_delay_ms, traf_delay_ms, ms_per_test, internal_repeats, hosts, warmup, mode, data_queue=None, succ_msg='', fail_msg='')[source]¶

Function executed by generator thread.

Parameters:
  • generator_run_handler (str) – generator run handler
  • generator_cpus (str) – Cpu ids we assign to generator thread
  • controller_ip (str) – controller IP
  • controller_port (int) – controller port
  • threads (int) – number of generator threads
  • sw_per_thread (int) – number of switches per thread
  • switches (int) – number of total switches
  • thr_delay – delay between thread creation
  • traf_delay – delay between last thread creation and traffic transmission
  • ms_per_test (int) – test duration of a single generator loop
  • internal_repeats (int) – number of generator loops
  • hosts (int) – number of simulated hoss
  • warmup (int) – initial loops to be considered as ‘warmup’
  • mode (int) – generator mode
  • data_queue (multiprocessing.Queue) – data queue where generator output is posted line by line
stress_test.generator_utils.rebuild_generator(generator_build_handler)[source]¶

Rebuilds the generator.

Parameters:generator_build_handler (str) – filepath to the handler that builds the generator
stress_test.generator_utils.run_generator(generator_run_handler, generator_cpus, controller_ip, controller_port, threads, sw_per_thread, switches, thr_delay_ms, traf_delay_ms, ms_per_test, internal_repeats, hosts, warmup, mode, data_queue=None)[source]¶

Runs a generator instance

Parameters:
  • generator_run_handler (str) – generator run handler
  • generator_cpus (str) – cpu ids we assign to generator (comma separated)
  • controller_ip (str) – controller IP for OpenFlow connection
  • controller_port (int) – controller port for OpenFlow connection
  • threads (int) – number of generator threads
  • sw_per_thread (int) – number of switches per thread
  • switches (int) – number of total switches
  • thr_delay_ms (int) – delay between thread creation (in milliseconds)
  • traf_delay_ms (int) – delay between last thread creation and traffic transmission (in milliseconds)
  • ms_per_test (int) – test duration of a single generator loop
  • internal_repeats (int) – number of generator loops
  • hosts (int) – number of simulated hoss
  • warmup (int) – initial loops to be considered as ‘warmup’
  • mode (int) – generator mode
  • data_queue (multiprocessing.Queue) – data queue where generator output is posted line by line the generator process will run.

mininet_utils Module¶

Mininet-related utilities

stress_test.mininet_utils.copy_mininet_handlers(mininet_ssh_server_ip, mininet_user, mininet_pass, mininet_source, mininet_target, remote_port=22)[source]¶

Copies Mininet handlers on the remote Mininet node

Parameters:
  • mininet_ssh_server_ip (str) – IP address of the ssh server on the Mininet node
  • mininet_user (str) – username for the Mininet node
  • mininet_pass (str) – password for the Mininet node
  • mininet_source – folder with Mininet handlers
  • mininet_target – folder where Mininet handlers will be copied
  • remote_port (int) – port for mininet_ssh_server_ip
stress_test.mininet_utils.delete_mininet_handlers(mininet_ssh_server_ip, mininet_user, mininet_pass, mininet_folder, remote_port=22)[source]¶

Cleans up Mininet handlers on the remote Mininet node

Parameters:
  • mininet_ssh_server_ip (str) – IP address of the ssh server on the Mininet node
  • mininet_user (str) – username for the Mininet node
  • mininet_pass (str) – password for the Mininet node
  • mininet_folder (str) – folder with Mininet handlers
  • remote_port (int) – port for mininet_ssh_server_ip
stress_test.mininet_utils.init_mininet_topo(mininet_init_topo_handler, mininet_rest_server_host, mininet_rest_server_port, controller_ip, controller_port, mininet_topology_type, mininet_size, mininet_group_size, mininet_group_delay_ms, mininet_hosts_per_switch)[source]¶

Locally calls the Mininet handler that remotely initializes a topology on a remote Mininet node

Parameters:
  • mininet_init_topo_handler – full path of the handler to initialize the mininet topology
  • mininet_rest_server_host – hostname/IP the REST server listens to
  • mininet_rest_server_port – port the REST server listens to
  • controller_ip – controller IP
  • controller_port – controller OpenFlow port
  • mininet_topology_type – Type of the network topology. It can have

one of the following values (DisconnectedTopo,LinearTopo or MeshTopo) :param mininet_size: Size of the mininet tpology :param mininet_group_size: Size of the mininet Group :param mininet_group_delay_ms: Delay in which mininet groups are

initialized
Parameters:mininet_hosts_per_switch (int) – Number of Hosts each mininet switch is attached to
stress_test.mininet_utils.start_mininet_server(mininet_ssh_session, mininet_server_remote_path, mininet_rest_server_host, mininet_rest_server_port)[source]¶

Remotely boots a REST server on the Mininet node over an SSH connection

Parameters:
  • mininet_ssh_session (ssh connection object) – ssh session used to issue remote command
  • mininet_server_remote_path (str) – path where mininet_custom_boot.py is stored and used to start the mininet topology.
  • mininet_rest_server_host (str) – hostname/IP the REST server should listen to
  • mininet_rest_server_port (int) – port the REST server should listen to
stress_test.mininet_utils.start_mininet_topo(mininet_start_handler, mininet_rest_server_host, mininet_rest_server_port)[source]¶

Locally calls the Mininet handler that remotely starts an initialized topology on a remote Mininet node

Parameters:
  • mininet_start_handler (str) – full path of the handler to start the Mininet topology
  • mininet_rest_server_host (str) – hostname/IP the REST server listens to
  • mininet_rest_server_port (int) – port the REST server listens to
stress_test.mininet_utils.stop_mininet_server(mininet_ssh_session, mininet_rest_server_port)[source]¶

Remotely stops the REST server on the Mininet node

Parameters:
  • mininet_ssh_session – ssh session used to issue remote command
  • mininet_rest_server_port (int) – port the REST server listens to
stress_test.mininet_utils.stop_mininet_topo(mininet_stop_handler, mininet_rest_server_host, mininet_rest_server_port)[source]¶

Locally calls the Mininet handler that remotely stops a topology on a remote Mininet node

Parameters:
  • mininet_stop_handler (str) – full path of the handler to stop the Mininet topology
  • mininet_rest_server_host (str) – hostname/IP the REST server listens to
  • mininet_rest_server_port (int) – port the REST server listens to

nstat_orchestrator Module¶

report_spec Module¶

Contains data structure of report element and tables inside the report. These are used to generate the html report

class stress_test.report_spec.ReportSpec(config_json, results_json, title, config_tables, results_table)[source]¶

Bases: object

Contains the specification of the html report, the title of the report, the json files of the configuration and data and the lists of tables to be generated in the report.

class stress_test.report_spec.TableSpec(table_type, title, keys, source_json, ordering_key=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Contains the rendering information for the tables of the html report.

sb_active_cbench Module¶

sb_idle_cbench Module¶

Idle Southbound Performance test

stress_test.sb_idle_cbench.get_report_spec(test_type, config_json, results_json)[source]¶

It returns all the information that is needed for the generation of the report for the specific test.

Parameters:test_type – describes the type of the specific test. This value

defines the title of the html report. :param config_json: this is the filepath to the configuration json file. :param results_json: this is the filepath to the results json file. :returns: A ReportSpec object that holds all the test report information and is passed as input to the generate_html() function in the html_generation.py, that is responsible for the report generation. :rtype: ReportSpec :type: test_type: str :type: config_json: str :type: results_json: str

stress_test.sb_idle_cbench.sb_idle_cbench_run(out_json, ctrl_base_dir, sb_gen_base_dir, conf, output_dir)[source]¶

Run test. This is the main function that is called from nstat_orchestrator and performs the specific test.

Parameters:
  • out_json (str) – the JSON output file
  • ctrl_base_dir (str) – controller base directory
  • sb_gen_base_dir (str) – generator base directory
  • conf (str) – JSON configuration dictionary
  • output_dir (str) – directory to store output files

sb_idle_mininet Module¶

Idle Southbound Performance test

stress_test.sb_idle_mininet.get_report_spec(test_type, config_json, results_json)[source]¶

It returns all the information that is needed for the generation of the report for the specific test.

Parameters:test_type – Describes the type of the specific test. This value

defines the Title of the html report. :param config_json: this is the filepath to the configuration json file. :param results_json: this is the filepath to the results json file. :returns: A ReportSpec object that holds all the test report information and is passed as input to the generate_html() function in the html_generation.py, that is responsible for the report generation. :rtype: ReportSpec :type: test_type: str :type: config_json: str :type: results_json: str

stress_test.sb_idle_mininet.sb_idle_mininet_run(out_json, ctrl_base_dir, mininet_base_dir, conf, output_dir)[source]¶

Run test. This is the main function that is called from nstat_orchestrator and performs the specific test.

Parameters:
  • out_json (str) – the JSON output file
  • ctrl_base_dir (str) – controller base directory
  • mininet_base_dir (str) – mininet base directory
  • conf (str) – JSON configuration dictionary
  • output_dir (str) – directory to store output files
